text: You must be familiar with AI, right? AI, also known as artificial intelligence, is a tool that greatly supports humans
in today's era. So, are you curious about how conversations related to AI take place?
Watch to discover and learn English through conversations.
Let's dive in.
AI art at the museum.
Hey Sophie, let's check out the AI art exhibition at this new museum.
No way. AI art? That's not real art.
It's just a bunch of algorithms pretending to be creative.
Come on, they wouldn't display something meaningless. AI generated art is fascinating.
Art is about human emotion. AI doesn't feel anything. It just processes data.
But artists also build on past works. AI just does it faster using millions of references.
Look at this. It's mimicking Van Go's style. It feels soulless.
Or maybe it's a new form of collaboration. Human creativity meets machine intelligence.
So, what's next? AI winning art competitions? Getting paid for paintings.
Funny you say that.
Last year, an AI artwork actually won a contest.
People were furious.
See, that's exactly my point. It's unfair to real artists,  but it also challenges them. Maybe it pushes human artists to innovate beyond
what AI can do.
H okay, you have a point. But if I see an AI generated Mona Lisa, I'm leaving.
Deal.
AI job interview.
Can't believe I just had a job interview with an AI.
Wait, what? The interviewer was an AI.
Yeah, no human at all.
Just a screen asking me questions.
That's so weird. How did it go? I don't know. It analyzed my tone, facial expressions, and word choice. I felt like I was being judged by a robot
overlord.
Maybe it found you statistically unfit for the job.
Don't joke. I don't even know if I did well.
Didn't they give you any feedback?
Just a score at the end like I was taking a test. That's so impersonal. I'd rather have a human interviewer.
Same. I miss awkward small talk and fake smiles.
Maybe AI will learn to fake that, too.
Well, if it gets the job instead of me, I'm going to lose it.
AI customer service fail.
I just spent 30 minutes arguing with a chatbot.
Oh no, what happened?
I wanted a refund, but it kept giving me random responses.
Did you try calling customer service?
Yeah, but guess what?
Phone system is AI, too.
You're trapped in the loop.
Exactly. It kept saying, "I understand your concern, but did nothing."  AI is supposed to make things easier, not worse.
Right. I just wanted a human. Is that too much to ask?
Apparently, yes. AI is taking over.
If AI wants to replace humans, it should at least be useful first.
Maybe next time just say, "Let me speak to your robot manager."  Good idea.
AI face recognition error.
I just got locked out of my phone.
Why? Forgot your password.
No, the face recognition won't recognize me.
Did you get a haircut or something?
Worse, I shaved my beard.
So, your phone thinks you're a different person.
Yep. I had to prove it was me with security questions.
What did you have to answer?
What's your pet's first name? Where did you go to school?
The usual.
And did you pass?
Barely. I almost forgot my own answers.
Wow, your phone acted like you were a complete stranger.
Yep. My own phone betrayed me.
Technology is amazing until it isn't.
I was about to ask my phone, "Who am I?" But I was afraid it would say no idea.
Imagine if it called the cops on you for trying to break into your own phone.
Don't even joke. I was already sweating.
So, what's the plan now?
Next time I'm keeping the beard.
Or maybe just print a picture of yourself with a beard and hold it up to the camera.
That's actually genius.
I was kidding.
I wasn't.
AI writes a love letter.
I wrote Sarah a love letter.
Aw, that's sweet. Let me see  here. AI helped me write it.
Wait, AI wrote this?
Well, I told it what I wanted to say. It just made it sound better.
Hold on. You let AI write a love letter for you. Not entirely. I gave it my ideas and it just cleaned them up.
Your eyes shine like a thousand stars.
Your voice is a melody that soothes my soul. Ben, come on.
Dude, have you ever said anything like that in real life?
No, but it sounds nice, right?
It sounds like AI tried too hard.
But my original draft was terrible. AI made it romantic.
Romantic?
This sounds like a chatbot trying to get a date.
Hello, Sarah. Would you like to upgrade to premium boyfriend mode?
Exactly. You need to write something real. Something that sounds like you.
But what if I mess it up? That's the point. It's supposed to be imperfect.
Yeah, Sarah will appreciate your honesty more than some fancy AI generated poetry.
So, should I rewrite it?
Yes. And this time, use your own words.
And don't make it sound like an AI proposing marriage.
Fine, but can I at least use spelljack?
I allow it.
The five conversations above have helped you understand more about AI related topics. But to learn more AI related
vocabulary, you have to watch until the end to see how good you are. Let's continue.
What is the best way to stay healthy?
Can I ask you one last question before I go, doctor? Of course. What's the best way to stay healthy? In your case, you
must quit smoking completely. I know.
I'll try my best. And having a good diet is probably the most important thing.
Like what? You don't want to eat food that's high in fat. You need to avoid caffeine and sugar. Besides food, what
else should I do? Getting 30 minutes of exercise a day is important. How about having a glass of wine on the weekend?
One glass a day is okay, but remember, don't overdo it. Thanks, doctor.
You're welcome.
I love going for walks in the park.
I love going for walks in the park. It's so peaceful. A great way to clear my mind.
Walking in the park is really nice.
Which park do you usually go to, Emily?
I usually go to Greenfield Park. It has beautiful trails and a lovely pond.
Oh, I know Greenfield Park. It's a great spot. Do you go there often?
Yeah, I try to go a few times a week. It helps me relax, especially after a long day at work.
That's a good idea. Maybe I should start doing that, too. Do you ever go for walks in the morning?
Sometimes on weekends. Mornings are so quiet and fresh. It's a nice start to the day.
Sounds lovely. Maybe I could join you for a walk one weekend. I'd like to get more exercise.
Absolutely, Ben. It would be nice to have some company. How about next Saturday?
Next Saturday works for me. Let's meet at the park entrance.
Perfect. Let's say 6:00 a.m. We can grab a coffee afterward if you like. Uh-huh.
You know, walking really helps me stay both mentally and physically healthy.
I can see that. It's such a simple habit, but it makes a big difference.
Exactly. Just a walk in nature can lift your mood and clear your mind.
I'm definitely looking forward to our walk next Saturday. Time to start a new healthy habit.
Yes. Let's make it a weekly thing if we can.
I grow my own vegetables.
I've never been to your place.
Make yourself at home.
Wow, you have a little garden. Can we go see it? I'd love to check out your garden.
Of course. Let's go.
Do you grow your own vegetables?
Yes, I grow my own vegetables.
You're great.
I used to grow flowers, but they all died.
Growing vegetables like this is also good. I want to have a little garden, too.
So, let's do it. I can share my experience.
Great. Thank you.
You're welcome.
I guess homegrown vegetables are safer, too, right?
Definitely. No chemicals. No worries.
And I bet they taste better than storebought ones.
They do. Fresher, cleaner, and so much better for your health.
All right, I'm sold. Let's start gardening.
I have a dentist appointment on Friday.
I have a dentist appointment on Friday.
I'm not really looking forward to it.
Oh, I understand, Amy. I always get a bit nervous before dentist visits.
What time is your appointment?
It's at 2:00 p.m. I'm hoping it won't take too long. It's just a routine checkup.
That's good. Routine checkups are important. Do you have any plans afterward to relax?
I hadn't thought about that. Maybe I'll treat myself. A coffee or a movie sounds nice.
A movie sounds like a great idea. It's a nice way to unwind. There's a new comedy playing at the cinema. That does sound
good. A comedy would definitely lighten the mood. Maybe I'll do that.
I could join you if you like. It might be fun to watch it together.
I'd like that, Max. It's a plan, then.
Let's meet at the cinema around 400 p.m.
Perfect. I'll book the tickets. And don't worry, the dentist appointment will be over before you know it.
Thanks for the encouragement. I'm feeling better about it already. See you on Friday.
She swims every morning.
Have you seen Anna lately?
Yes, I see her at the pool often.
Really? I didn't know she likes swimming.
She swims every morning. It's her new routine.
Every morning? That's impressive.
Yes, she's very dedicated.
Maybe I should start swimming, too.
It's a great way to stay fit.
Do you swim often?
Well, yes. Not as much as Anna.
Maybe we could go together sometime.
That would be fun. I'll ask Anna to join us, too.
A swimming group sounds good.
I'll let you know when we're going again.
Great. I need to buy swimming trunks.
Don't forget goggles, too.
Right. Goggles. I'll get those.
You look really tired.
Hey, Mary.
Yeah.
Are you okay?
Not really.
Look at you. You look really tired.
I know.
What's wrong?
My son cried all night, so I couldn't sleep.
Is your son sick?
I don't know. My husband took him to the doctor this morning.
I hope he's okay. Why didn't you take the day off today?
I have an important meeting with the manager. After the meeting, maybe I will ask to go home soon.
I have an ear ache.
Mom, I have an ear ache. Let me see. Can I use cotton buds? It feels like there's water stuck in my ear.
No, we shouldn't use cotton buds. Did you swim in the pool?
Yes, you may have an ear infection.
What's an ear infection?
An ear infection is an infection of the middle ear. It causes ear pain.
Is it serious?
Do you have severe ear pain?
No, it just hurts a little.
I'll take you to the doctor anyway.
Okay, Mom.
He does not smoke anymore.
Hey, my family has a barbecue party this weekend. Do you want to join us?
Of course. I love grilled meat. But will your brother join the barbecue?
Of course. He's my family.
I really can't stand the smell of cigarette smoke. I hate it. Every time I see him, he smokes.
Don't worry, he doesn't smoke anymore.
Really?
Yeah.
What made him quit smoking?
His new girlfriend.
Oh, is she coming this weekend, too?
Yes. He never stops talking about her.
I can't wait to meet her.
Me, too.
He fell down the stairs.
Did you hear about Joe?
No. What happened?
He fell down the stairs.
Oh no. Is he okay?
He's fine, but his cat got scared and ran up a tree.
A tree inside the house.
No, silly. Outside in the garden.
So Joe fell. The cat freaked out. But is Joe okay?
Just a small bruise. He's more worried about the cat now.
Is the cat still up the tree?
Yes, Joe is trying to get it down.
I hope he doesn't fall again.
He's being careful. Maybe he needs a helmet next time.
A helmet to save a cat. That will be a funny picture.
Let's snap a photo if he actually does.
Sure. It's like a comedy show with Joe and his cat.
Brushing teeth in the morning.
Hi everyone. I'm home.
Hi honey. Oh, what's that you've got there?
Oh, this it's cake. I stopped by the new bakery on the way home.
How many slices did you get?
Well, let's see. One, two, three, four, and five.
Five slices. There are only three of us.
I just couldn't resist those delicious slices of cake, honey.
Well, I guess we're having cake for dinner tonight.
Oh, Brian, how are you?
Hi, Dad.
You seem upset. Are you okay?
I guess so.
Hey, I have some good news for you.
What's that, Dad?
Today we're having cake for dinner.
Why are you upset? Don't you like cake?
Yes, I do, Dad. But not today.
Ryan, what's wrong with your face? It's swollen.
My teeth hurt, Mom.
Open your mouth. Let me see.
Oh my. You have a cavity.
Did you forget to brush your teeth again?
No, Dad. I brush my teeth every night before bed.
Honey, you must brush your teeth twice a day. Before bed and after waking up.
M but I always wake up late so I don't have time. You should wake up earlier.
Yes, Mom. But what should I do now about my teeth? We'll go to the dentist.
Will my tooth decay go away?
Sure, honey. But for now, I don't think we should have cake for dinner anymore.
cooking dinner together.
Mom, I'm home.
Welcome home, Sarah. How was your day?
It was fine. I guess.
Hey, Tom. What are you doing in the kitchen?
Can't you see? I'm helping mom cook dinner.
You're helping mom cook? What's the occasion?
Did you watch too much Master Chef last night?
I want to learn how to cook.
Great job, bro. Let's see. What are you cooking?
H What's this called, Mom?
It's meat pie, sweetie.
It's meat pie.
Amazing. It's my favorite. Can I have a bite?
Not now, Sarah. It's not done yet. Plus, you haven't washed your hands.
Your brother's right. Go wash your hands, Sarah. All right. All right, chefs. I'll go wash my hands now.
Hey, wait. Could you help me take out the trash, please?
Right now, Mom. Isn't it Tom's turn to take out the trash?
Can't you see he's helping me cook? And you haven't washed your hands anyway?
Okay.
Thank you, sister. I'll make sure your delicious meat pie is ready when you get back. You better
playing board games.
It's still raining heavily. Looks like no cinema for us today.
Oh no. I was really looking forward to seeing the movie. Hey, we can still watch it another day.
But I told my friends I would tell them about the movie next week. Don't be so upset, Dylan. If we can go out today,
can I stay in my room and play games?
Well, how about we play games together?
I didn't know you play video games, too, Mom.
No, I mean board games.
Board games? That sounds boring.
Hey, don't say that when you haven't tried playing them.
Your mom's right, Dylan. That's how our generation had fun back in the day.
Okay, so what will we play?
I suggest Monopoly. It's both fun and realistic. It helps you learn how to spend money wisely.
I disagree. I think Scrabble's better.
It helps you learn words.
Come on, this isn't a lesson. Why would you want to learn words?
Actually, you know what? My friend showed me a board game before. It has a map that looks like a beehive.
You mean Katana? That game is amazing.
You're right. How about we play it?
Absolutely.
Doing chores.
It's not fair. I always have to do the dishes.
No way. I did them last night.
You did not. I did.
Mom, tell her I did the dishes.
What's going on here? He says he did the dishes, but he didn't.
I did them.
Okay, calm down. Let's sort this out.
What's the problem?
We both say we did the dishes, but only one of us did.
How about we check the chore chart? Good idea. Let's see. Adam, you were supposed to do the dishes last night.
See, I did them.
But they weren't clean, so I had to redo them. All right, let's make this fair.
From now on, we'll switch chores every week.
Yes. and we'll all doublech checkck the chart daily.
Fine, but he has to take out the trash this week.
And she has to clean the bathroom.
Deal. We all need to pitch in and help out. And remember, no arguing. We work as a team.
Okay, I'll do my chores.
Me, too, I guess.
Good. Now, let's get to work and maybe we can all relax afterward.
Going to the park.
Why do we have to go to the park? It's boring.
Yeah, I wanted to stay home and play video games.
We need some fresh air and exercise.
It'll be fun.
And it's good for us to spend time together as a family.
I don't want to. There's nothing to do there.
Same. All my friends are online.
You can play games with your friends later. Right now, let's enjoy the park.
Can we at least get ice cream afterward?
How old are you, Emma? Why would you want ice cream?
I can help you get your ice cream if you don't want it.
All right. All right. I'll buy you ice cream, but only if you come with a good attitude.
And no complaining while we're here.
Cool. But I want to go to the ice cream place I like.
Can I have two ice creams?
Hey, you said you didn't want ice cream.
I asked why you would want ice cream.
Come on, kids. If you can manage not to fight for the next 2 hours, you can get as much ice cream as you want.
That sounds like a good deal, Dad. Deal.
Thanks, Dad.
Visiting grandparents.
Look who's here. Welcome, kids.
It's so good to see you both. How was your trip?
It was fine, Grandpa. We're glad to be here.
Yeah, it's been a while. We missed you.
We missed you, too. Come in and make yourselves at home.
Are you hungry? We made your favorite cookies.
Chocolate chip? You're the best, Grandma. Can I have one now?
Of course. Sit down first and I'll bring you some cookies.
So, what have you two been up to lately?
School's been busy, but it's going well.
I've been playing a lot of football. We had a big game last week.
That sounds exciting. Did you win?
Yes, we did. It was awesome.
That's great. We're so proud of you.
What about you two? How have you been?
We've been good. Keeping busy with the garden and some new hobbies.
What kind of hobbies?
I've been learning to paint and grandma's trying her hand at knitting.
That sounds fun. Can we see what you've made?
Of course. We'd love to show you. This visit is going to be so much fun.
We're glad you think so. Let's make the most of it.
Absolutely. We're happy to be here.
We're happy you're here, too. Now, let's enjoy those cookies.
